title: 107_s550
content: The Act titled "Indian and Alaska Native Foster Care and Adoption Services Amendments of 2001" allows Indian tribes to receive federal funds for foster care and adoption assistance. SEC. 2 of the "Indian and Alaska Native Foster Care and Adoption Services Amendments of 2001" grants Indian tribes the authority to receive federal funds for foster care and adoption assistance, including children placed in tribal custody. SEC. 479B grants Indian tribal organizations the authority to operate programs. Indian tribes can elect to operate programs under this part, subject to certain modifications in plan requirements. These modifications include identifying service areas and populations to be served, and approving foster homes based on tribal standards to ensure child safety. Federal share determination is based on per capita income. The Federal medical assistance percentage for an Indian tribe is based on per capita income, calculated using the service population defined in the tribe's plan. Tribes can submit relevant information for consideration in the calculation. Administrative expenditures proportions are determined by the Secretary through regulations. The Secretary considers information before making calculations. Administrative expenditures proportions are determined by the Secretary through regulations. Indian tribes can use Federal or State funds to match payments. The Secretary may modify requirements if it benefits the safety of children served by the tribes. The Secretary may modify requirements under this part to benefit the safety of children served by Indian tribes. Participating tribes in an intertribal consortium can submit a single plan. Indian tribes or consortiums can enter into cooperative agreements with states for fund administration. Regulations must be established within one year. The Secretary shall promulgate regulations within one year in consultation with Indian tribes and tribal organizations. The amendments made by this section take effect upon enactment of the Act, regardless of regulations being in place.
